questions.question: 1) When Sutton Bonington was two separate villages, Sutton (south farm) and Bonington (Babington or Buna’s farm) which church would have been in Sutton?
2) During the first World War there was a prisoners of war camp in the village, where was it?
answers: At what is now the University
At what is now the playing fields by the Scout Hut
in the field opposite St Ann’s Manor
At What is now the school

questions.question: 3) Which long-distance footpath passes through the parish of Sutton Bonington on its way between West Leake and Kegworth?
4) Which of these counties does not boarder Nottinghamshire?
5) If you put your canoe in the River Soar at the end of the playing fields, which of these water ways could you NOT paddle to?
6) Which of these European countries boarders the greatest number of other countries?
8) 7.1% of the UK population lives in which region?
10) If you fly due north from Sutton Bonington, where would you first cross the coast line?
